text: Hugo Gottschlich (1905–1984) was an Austrian stage and film actor, who specialised in Viennese character parts.Fritsche p.148 Later in his career he appeared frequently on television. ==Selected filmography== * Arlberg Express (1948) * Fregola (1948) * On Resonant Shores (1948) * Kissing Is No Sin (1950) * Cordula (1950) * City Park (1951) * Miracles Still Happen (1951) * White Shadows (1951) * Vienna Waltzes (1951) * 1. April 2000 (1952) * A Night in Venice (1953) * To Be Without Worries (1953) * Anna Louise and Anton (1953) * The Spendthrift (1953) * Mozart (1955) * Sarajevo (1955) * Imperial and Royal Field Marshal (1956) * The Saint and Her Fool (1957) * Vienna, City of My Dreams (1957) * And Lead Us Not Into Temptation (1957) * Candidates for Marriage (1958) * The Priest and the Girl (1958) * The Good Soldier Schweik (1960) * Mariandl (1961) * Mariandl's Homecoming (1962) * Marry Me, Cherie (1964) * Der Weibsteufel (1966) ==References== ==Bibliography== * Fritsche, Maria. Homemade Men In Postwar Austrian Cinema: Nationhood, Genre and Masculinity . Berghahn Books, 2013. ==External links== * Category:1905 births Category:1984 deaths Category:Austrian male film actors Category:Austrian male stage actors Category:Male actors from Vienna
title: Hugo Gottschlich
